main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted above a thunderstorm in Knoxville, Tennessee, on June 22, 1958, observed by Major Kenneth M. Boothh.
interesting points: The object was described as brilliant white and smaller than a plane., It was observed for about 2-3 seconds at an altitude of approximately 12,000 feet., The observer reported no sound from the object., The object's trajectory was instantaneous, moving southward., Weather conditions included scattered clouds and visibility of 9 miles; no thunderstorms were reported at the airport.
witness description: Major Kenneth M. Boothh, a reliable witness.
